verses.text: 以色列重歸故土耶和華憐憫雅各，再揀選以色列，使他們安居在自己的國土上的時候，外族人必與他們聯合，歸屬於雅各家。
以色列人必把他們帶回自己的國土去，以色列家必在耶和華所賜的地上得著這些外族人作僕婢；也要擄掠那些擄掠過他們的，並且統治那些欺壓過他們的。
譏諷巴比倫之歌耶和華使你脫離痛苦、愁煩、被迫作的苦工，得享安息的日子，

words.note: Literary equivalent of '的'.

verses.text: 你必唱出這首詩歌來諷刺巴比倫王，說：「欺壓人的，怎麼止息了呢！強暴怎麼止住了呢！
耶和華折斷了惡人的杖和統治者的棒，
就是那在忿怒中不住擊打眾民、在怒氣中管轄列國、毫無抑制地施行迫害的。

words.note: A more intense form of anger, often with indignation.
Forms an adjectival phrase or nominalizes a clause.

verses.text: 現在全地都平靜安息，各人都發聲歡呼。

words.note: Often refers to Sabbath rest or eternal rest.

verses.text: 連松樹和黎巴嫩的香柏樹都因你歡樂，說：『自從你躺下以後，再沒有砍伐的人上來砍伐我們了。』

words.note: Forms an adjectival phrase or nominalizes a clause.
Indicates a new situation or completion.

verses.text: 地下的陰間因你震動，並迎接你的來臨；又因你而喚醒了所有曾在地上作過領袖的陰魂；又使所有曾在列國中作君王的，都離位站起來。

words.note: Refers to the realm of the dead in biblical contexts.
Often used for significant or impending arrivals.
Forms an adjectival phrase or nominalizes a clause.
Refers to the disembodied spirits in the afterlife.
Forms an adjectival phrase or nominalizes a clause.

verses.text: 他們都必答話，對你說：『你也變為衰弱，像我們一樣嗎？你也與我們相似嗎？』
你的威勢和你的琴瑟音樂，都被帶下陰間了；你下面鋪的是蟲，上面蓋的是蛆。

words.note: Refers to impressive authority or might.
Ancient Chinese stringed instruments, often symbolic of music.
Refers to the realm of the dead.

verses.text: 明亮之星、清晨之子啊！你怎麼從天上墜落？你這傾覆列國的，怎麼被砍倒在地上？

words.note: Classical Chinese particle, similar to '的'.
Refers to the celestial or divine realm.
Often used for a dramatic or significant fall.
Implies causing destruction or ruin.
Forms a nominal phrase: 'the one who overthrows nations'.
Refers to the physical world.

verses.text: 你心裡曾說：『我要升到天上，我要高舉我的寶座到 神的眾星之上，我要坐在聚會的山上，在北方的極處。

words.note: Refers to the celestial or divine realm.
Often used in religious contexts for exalting God or a throne.
A blank space used in some Chinese Bibles to denote reverence before God's name.

words.definition: all the stars, multitude of stars

words.note: Literally 'of above', meaning 'above'.
Refers to a sacred or formal assembly, e.g., for worship.
Suffix indicating location 'on' or 'above'.
Refers to the most distant or extreme point.

verses.text: 我要升到雲的高處，我要使自己像那至高者一般。』

words.note: A title for God in the Bible.
Suffix meaning 'like' or 'of the same kind'.

verses.text: 然而，你卻被拋下陰間，落到坑中的極處。

words.note: Refers to the realm of the dead.
Often refers to the pit of Sheol/hell in biblical context.
Refers to the most distant or extreme point.

verses.text: 那些看見你的，都必定睛看你，他們必注視著你，說：『那使大地震動，使列國搖撼，

words.note: Often used for divine decree or strong certainty in biblical texts.
Lit. 'fix eyes'.

verses.text: 使世界如同荒野，傾覆城鎮，又不釋放囚犯的，就是這人嗎？』
列國的君王都在榮耀中安睡，各在自己的墳墓裡。
但你要從你的墳墓中被逐出，好像一根被厭棄的樹枝，你被那些遭刀劍所殺的人掩蓋，就是那些被拋到坑中石頭那裡的人。你就像一具遭人踐踏的屍體。

words.note: For long, slender objects.
Often used with 被 for passive voice.
Measure word for corpses.

verses.text: 你必不得與別的君王同葬，因為你敗壞了你的國，殺戮了你的人民；願那些惡人的後裔永遠不被人提說。

words.note: Combined with 不 means 'cannot' or 'must not'.
Often means 'kingdom' in biblical context.

verses.text: 因為他們的祖宗犯了罪孽，你們要為他的子孫預備屠殺之處；不要讓他們興起來，佔有地土，在世上布滿城鎮。」

words.note: Literary equivalent of '的', often found in classical or formal texts.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「我必興起攻擊他們，把巴比倫的名號、所剩餘的人，以及後裔子孫，都一同剪除。」這是耶和華說的。

words.note: A divine title for God, emphasizing his sovereignty over all armies/powers.
Strong affirmation of future action, common in prophecy.
Introduces object of verb, indicating its disposal/manipulation.
Indicates something that is 'what is done' or 'that which is'.
Implies a complete removal or destruction.

verses.text: 「我必使巴比倫被箭豬所佔，又使它變為泥沼之地；我必用毀滅的掃帚把它掃淨。」這是萬軍之耶和華說的。

words.note: Indicates the agent of a passive action, often with '被'.
Literary equivalent of '的', often found in classical or formal texts.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華起了誓，說：「我怎樣想，事就怎樣成就；我怎樣計劃，事就怎樣立定，

words.note: Implies a firm and unchangeable establishment.

verses.text: 就是在我的地上粉碎亞述人，在我的山上踐踏他；他所加的軛必離開以色列人，他所加的重擔必離開以色列人的肩頭。」
這就是對全地所定的旨意，就是向列國伸出的手。

words.note: Introduces a passive or nominalized verb.

verses.text: 因為萬軍之耶和華決定的事，誰能阻攔呢？他的手伸了出來，誰能使他收回呢？

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive particle, similar to 'de'.

verses.text: 亞哈斯王去世的那一年，有以下的默示：

words.note: Lit. 'silent revelation'.

verses.text: 預言非利士地的災禍非利士全地啊！不要因為那擊打你們的杖折斷了就歡喜，因為從蛇的根必生出毒蛇來，牠所生的，是會飛的蛇。

words.note: Can be a noun (prophecy) or verb (to prophesy).
Refers to the land or people of Philistia.
Refers to the land or people of Philistia.
Nominalizes the verb '生'.

verses.text: 最貧寒的人必有食物吃，貧乏人必安然躺臥；我必用饑荒毀滅你的根，你餘剩的人，必被饑荒所殺。

words.note: Follows '被' to indicate the agent of a passive action.

verses.text: 城門啊，要哀號！城鎮啊，要呼叫！非利士全地啊，要戰慄發軟！因為有煙從北方來，在他的行伍中沒有離隊逃走的。

words.note: Refers to military formation or ranks.
Used here to turn the preceding verb phrase into a noun phrase 'those who have fled'.

verses.text: 人要怎樣回答外族的使者呢？要說：「耶和華建立了錫安，他子民中的困苦人必在其中避難。」

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
A hill in Jerusalem, often used to refer to Jerusalem or God's people.
Literally 'children-people', often used in biblical context for God's people.
Refers to those in hardship or suffering.
